intro: Tissa media, commonly known as the common tissa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are often eaten by birds and small mammals. Tissa media is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
